required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of a Universal Adhesive in Noncarious Cervical Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of a Universal Adhesive in Noncarious Cervical Lesions

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this prospective clinical trial will be to evaluate the efficacy of an FDA approved and marketed universal dental adhesive formulation in adult noncarious cervical lesions using self-etch and selective etch approaches.
The hypothesis is that using a selective enamel etch with this universal adhesive will enhance the restoration margin performance.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this prospective clinical trial will be to evaluate the efficacy of a newly formulated universal dental adhesive formulation in adult noncarious cervical lesions using self-etch and selective etch approaches.
Thirty-three patients with at least two non-carious cervical lesions will receive one restoration utilizing the self-etch universal adhesive with no separate enamel etching and another restoration utilizing the universal adhesive and a a selective etch protocol in which in which enamel is etched with 37% phosphoric acid.
After a screening/baseline visit at which the restorative procedures listed above will conducted, the patient will be seen at recall visits after approximately 6, 12 and 24 months to observe sensitivity, retention, marginal discoloration and marginal adaptation.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure will be restoration retention. In these non-retentive dental lesions, the adhesive will be the only mode of retention. Failure of the adhesive would result in loss of the restoration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Restoration Margins Marked as Stained or Discolored
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary outcome measure was the presence of discoloration of restoration margins as determined by blinded evaluators.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adhese Universal with self etch enamel etching
arm_group.description: patients will receive one restoration on randomly selected study tooth utilizing the self-etch universal adhesive (Adhese Universal, Ivoclar Vivadent) with no separate enamel etching

arm_group.arm_group_label: selective etch protocol followed by Adhese Universal
arm_group.description: patients will receive one restoration on randomly selected study tooth utilizing a 37% phosphoric acid solution followed by application of self-etch universal adhesive (Adhese Universal, Ivoclar Vivadent)

intervention.description: The adhesive will be applied according to manufacturer's instructions. If the lesion is greater than 2 mm in any dimension, incremental placement of Tetric EvoCeram composite (Ivoclar Vivadent) will occur with the first increment being placed against enamel.
intervention.arm_group_label: Adhese Universal with self etch enamel etching
selective etch protocol followed by Adhese Universal

intervention.description: Total Etch (37% phosphoric acid; Ivoclar) will be placed on the enamel margin with no intentional placement on the dentin within the lesion. The adhesive will then be applied as instructed by the manufacturer. Tetric EvoCeram composite will be placed, light-cured, finished, and polished in the same manner as for the self-etch group.
intervention.arm_group_label: Adhese Universal with self etch enamel etching
selective etch protocol followed by Adhese Universal

intervention.description: the universal adhesive, Adhese Universal , will be applied to the selected tooth following manufacturer instructions
intervention.arm_group_label: Adhese Universal with self etch enamel etching
selective etch protocol followed by Adhese Universal

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Adhese Universal With Self Etch Enamel Etching
group.description: patients will receive one restoration on randomly selected study tooth utilizing the self-etch universal adhesive (Adhese Universal, Ivoclar Vivadent) with no separate enamel etching Self etch enamel etching: The adhesive will be applied according to manufacturer's instructions. If the lesion is greater than 2 mm in any dimension, incremental placement of Tetric EvoCeram composite (Ivoclar Vivadent) will occur with the first increment being placed against enamel. Adhese Universal: the universal adhesive, Adhese Universal , will be applied to the selected tooth following manufacturer instructions

group.title: Selective Etch Protocol Followed by Adhese Universal
group.description: patients will receive one restoration on randomly selected study tooth utilizing a 37% phosphoric acid solution followed by application of self-etch universal adhesive (Adhese Universal, Ivoclar Vivadent) selective etch protocol: Total Etch (37% phosphoric acid; Ivoclar) will be placed on the enamel margin with no intentional placement on the dentin within the lesion. The adhesive will then be applied as instructed by the manufacturer. Tetric EvoCeram composite will be placed, light-cured, finished, and polished in the same manner as for the self-etch group. Adhese Universal: the universal adhesive, Adhese Universal , will be applied to the selected tooth following manufacturer instructions

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
